page.title: 01SOUTH CHELTENHAM IN 1985
page.content: The area that Christchurch,Warden Hill and St John's Schools together have surveyed is the southern part of Cheltenham. The area is a mixture of older housing and new houses,busy shopping roads and quite a few educational establishments and open spaces.South of Greatfield Lane and Farmfield Road is still unspoilt countryside, mainly used for grazing cattle and sheep.We live in a very pleasant area really with lovely views of Leckhampton Hill. There are good amenities such as buses,shops, schools,pubs,churches and open spaces. There is no industry to spoil the area and there are very pleasant walks in the parks and gardens which are kept very beautiful.All interests are catered for locally whatever your hobby or leisure activity may be.
